DOC Search 2018 Updates Increase Precision for Medical Searches View this email in your browser
Dear {!Contact.FirstName},
You have enterprise-wide access to DOC Search, Doctor Evidenceâ€™s newest AI literature search tool. Access DOC Search by logging in to: https://bms.doctorevidence.com
DOC Search is a powerful medical search engine, fueled by natural language processing (NLP) and artificial intelligence, which enables you to:
Quickly evaluate the evidence landscape across a wide range of medical data sources to identify, analyze, and monitor the available evidence. Search over 30+ million items, including trial registries, manuscripts, conference abstracts, drug labels, and news articles (PubMed, ClinicalTrials.gov, WHO-ICTRP, DailyMed, EPAR, and 85 RSS feeds). Identify KOLs and their scientific networks Save searches for automated literature monitoring
Click here to receive training and/or more information on DOC Search
New features released in November:
New data sources, including meeting abstracts from the American Society of Hematology (ASH) and American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) Drug labels are now linked to the trials and publications that supported each USPI More precise searching & review, including the ability to limit searches to title, abstract, or affiliation fields Monitor literature with automated weekly email alerts
Click here to see a 3-minute video update
DOC Search technology is populated with ASH and ASCO meeting abstracts, enabling analysis of methods, results, and trends to prepare for upcoming meetings:
Meeting Preparation: New meeting abstracts are released in-system on the embargo date. Save searches and immediately receive targeted reference lists to prepare for upcoming meetings Automated Term Indexing: NLP technology is applied to all meeting abstracts to index the reported patient characteristics, interventions, and outcome measures. Review a summary table of this automated term indexing to identify the top co-occurring concepts in your topic area of interest. Author Analysis: Identify the top thought leaders presenting in your topic areas of interest and inform strategy and planning for meeting attendance. Review an author's full list of publications, along with their affiliations, contact information, scientific network, and more. Lineage: Quickly navigate between associated references with automated linkage to the other data sources in DOC Search. Follow the lineage of a study from the original trial registration, to meeting abstracts, and all the way to primary and secondary manuscript publications, news articles, and drug labels.
ASH DOC Search and ASCO DOC Search are separate, supplementary add-on content options to the DOC Search base subscription.
If you need any specific help with DOC Search please contact Greg Lieberman, Associate Director, DOC Search at glieberman@doctorevidence.com
